definition.text: Many users choose to run the two branches from separate folders! This seems like a sensible solution for active contributors!

paragraphs.text: You may have two clones of your fork running from separate folders, each on different branches.
Two instances of Superalogs running from different folders are completely independent. They run distinct workspaces and output unique data.

Such a setup allows you to run the stable version for your production tasks, and the version in another branch to contribute and test new features! But you can't run two versions at the same time, unless you change ports! We won't go there now!
